page.name: What is the Rosary?
page.content:
What is the Rosary?

The Rosary is a Scripture-based prayer rooted in Sacred Scripture that helps us meditate on the lives of Jesus and Mary. It is one of the most beloved and powerful devotions in the Catholic Church.

A Christ-Centered Prayer

Although we address many prayers to Mary in the Rosary, this devotion is ultimately Christ-centered. As we pray, we meditate on key events—called "Mysteries"—from the life of Jesus Christ.

Why Do We Pray the Rosary?

  • To grow closer to God through meditation on the life of Christ
  • To seek Mary's intercession in our needs and intentions
  • To fortify our Catholic beliefs through reflection on Scripture
  • To pray for others including the sick, deceased, and those in need

"The Rosary is a compendium of the Gospel." — Pope St. Paul VI
